workoutLevels.name: Beginner
workoutLevels.focus: Learn proper form, build basic fitness, start a routine.
workoutLevels.plan: 2-3 days a week, 20-30 minutes per session, using body weight and light exercises.

workoutLevels.name: Intermediate
workoutLevels.focus: Enhance strength and endurance, diversify workouts.
workoutLevels.plan: 3-5 days a week, 45-60 minutes per session, mixing resistance training and cardio.

workoutLevels.name: Expert
workoutLevels.plan: 5-7 days a week, 60-90+ minutes per session, using advanced and specialized routines.

muscle_groups.name: quadriceps
muscle_groups.info: Front thigh muscles, crucial for leg extension and stability.

muscle_groups.name: shoulders
muscle_groups.info: Deltoid muscles, responsible for shoulder and arm movement.

muscle_groups.name: abdominals
muscle_groups.info: Core muscles, important for trunk stability and flexion.

muscle_groups.name: chest
muscle_groups.info: Pectoral muscles, essential for pushing movements.

muscle_groups.name: hamstrings
muscle_groups.info: Back thigh muscles, important for leg flexion and hip extension.

muscle_groups.name: triceps
muscle_groups.info: Back of the upper arm, responsible for arm extension.

muscle_groups.name: biceps
muscle_groups.info: Front of the upper arm, important for arm flexion.

muscle_groups.name: lats
muscle_groups.info: Latissimus dorsi, key for pulling movements and back strength.

muscle_groups.name: middle back
muscle_groups.info: Rhomboids and middle trapezius, important for scapular movement and posture.

muscle_groups.name: calves
muscle_groups.info: Lower leg muscles, essential for ankle movement and stability.

muscle_groups.name: lower back
muscle_groups.info: Erector spinae, crucial for spinal extension and posture.

muscle_groups.name: forearms
muscle_groups.info: Muscles of the lower arm, important for wrist and hand movements.

muscle_groups.name: glutes
muscle_groups.info: Buttock muscles, essential for hip movement and lower body power.

muscle_groups.name: traps
muscle_groups.info: Trapezius muscles, important for neck and shoulder movements.

muscle_groups.name: adductors
muscle_groups.info: Inner thigh muscles, important for bringing the legs together.

muscle_groups.name: abductors
muscle_groups.info: Outer thigh muscles, essential for moving the legs apart.

muscle_groups.name: neck
muscle_groups.info: Cervical muscles, important for head movement and stability.

equipment_types.name: barbell
equipment_types.info: A long bar with weights on each end, used for compound lifts.

equipment_types.name: dumbbell
equipment_types.info: A short bar with weights on each end, used for various exercises.

equipment_types.name: calisthenics
equipment_types.info: Bodyweight exercises for strength and endurance.

equipment_types.name: cable
equipment_types.info: Equipment using a pulley system for resistance exercises.

equipment_types.name: machine
equipment_types.info: Equipment that guides movements, often targeting specific muscles.

equipment_types.name: kettlebells
equipment_types.info: Weight with a handle, used for dynamic and strength exercises.

equipment_types.name: bands
equipment_types.info: Elastic bands used for resistance training and stretching.

equipment_types.name: medicine ball
equipment_types.info: Weighted ball used for explosive exercises and core training.

equipment_types.name: exercise ball
equipment_types.info: Large inflatable ball used for stability and core exercises.

equipment_types.name: foam roll
equipment_types.info: Cylindrical foam tool used for muscle recovery and myofascial release.

equipment_types.name: e-z curl bar
equipment_types.info: Curved barbell used to reduce strain during arm exercises.
